column4: I have a ubuntu machine that keeps mounting read only.  running fsck recovers the journal and shows an orphaned inode but it continuously corrupts again and again.  More info here: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=11146069
monitor dmesg output. it could be a failing hard drive.
i would guess it is a hd that is failing.. they seem the weakest link these days.
what would a line look like?  I can't see anything in there pertaining to the hard drive
io error,  'remounting read only' or somthing similer.
I also tried western digital's drive tools and it checked fine.  brand new hard drive.. was actually a replacement for a shoddy one.
if you can get an idea where the bad part of the HD is at.. you could repartition and put the bad part in its own parittion then not use it.
any idea how I would confirm it was bad?
that is weird. but not unheard of..   mostof these HD makers have tools (windows only) to do very through tests on the hds.
western digital seemed to offer a bootable CD that went to Dos and ran a custom program.. all tests were fine
ive gone through more hd;'s then i have any other pc part in the last few years.
but how through were the tests?  ive  seen some testes that take several hours to run.. and some that take just a few sec.
one took 15 mins one took around 2-3 hours
if you can suggest anything else..  I have a full backup of the home directory and have already rebuilt the software once... can try again..
i had a seagate tool/test of a 1tb hd.. took like a week. :)
this is only 80 gigs
but then the hd started working right.. after the test beat it in to submission i guess..
80gb? how old is that thing?
I bought the smallest new brand name drive I could find
it was an incredible waste of money..  but I wanted to get the kiddos computer fixed quickly
thats a normal line i belive..  when you find the HD gettting remounted read only, check dmesg again and there should be some error messages going on.
ke1ha did I miss anything?  I disconnected after I said it was read only now
normally i see some info/messages about mine gettting a read/write error and remounting read only.. and a block # or some other info in dmesg output.

ke1ha thank you for your help and support..  I'm trying an advanced drive fitness test from hitachi now that I found googling.  still lost as to why there are no errors except the ones about it mounting read-only...  (no write errors or anything before that..)
